intro: Endotropis auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate endotropis, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
